title: To find whether an object was constructed by a certain constructor or one inheriting from it, you can use the
instanceof
c
command:

inline_content.Text: To find whether an object was constructed by a certain constructor or one inheriting from it, you can use the

title: Note that primitive values are not considered instances of any class:

inline_content.Text: Note that primitive values are not considered instances of any class:

title:
console.log(2 instanceof Number)        //false
console.log('abc' instanceof String)    //false
console.log(true instanceof Boolean)    //false
console.log(Symbol() instanceof Symbol) //false

content_resolved.code:
console.log(2 instanceof Number)        //false
console.log('abc' instanceof String)    //false
console.log(true instanceof Boolean)    //false
console.log(Symbol() instanceof Symbol) //false

title: Every value in JavaScript besides
null
c
and
undefined
c
also has a
constructor
c
property storing the function that was used to construct it. This even works with primitives.

inline_content.Text: property storing the function that was used to construct it. This even works with primitives.
